(to recreate fail to import the org.eclipse.jdt.debug.ui plugin then launch 
the target then open the debug perspective)
A series of dialogs opened quickly then the target window disappeared.

That is the implemented behavior.

An internal error occurred and we tried to show it to the user by opening a 
dialog. While we opened that dialog another error occurred.
We do not have control over the events that run on the event loop so anything 
can happen while we should an internal error to the user. Including another 
internal error.

If we opened a dialog without the event loop, the user could not click OK.

So, if recursive errors occur we can't do much but exit the workbench.
Suggestions?

Do we log anything in this case?
Probably should (or at least try).

Yes we log the exception.
Please reopen this report if you have any idea on how to implement something 
better.
